info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 7 at 2:30PM CDT until October 7 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southmost, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Brownsville South Padre Island International Airport, Southmost Elementary School, Lopez High School, North Brownsville Little League, Besteiro Middle School, Villa Pancho, Brownsville Public Library Southmost Branch, El Jardin Elementary School, Perkins Middle School, Rivera High School, Gonzalez Elementary School, Faulk Middle School, Veterans International Bridge, J.t. Canales Elementary School, South Point and Longoria Elementary School. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
